column1: Highday (archaic form Hihdei) was the seventh and last day of the week in the Shire Calendar. It represented the Númenórean day Orbelain
column2: dedicated to the Valar. As such it was the chief day of the week and after noon Hobbits considered it a holiday with evening feasts.

column1: After the reform of Isengrim Took II
column2: dates such as 1 Lithe and 1 Yule always fell on Highday. There was no month beginning with Highday
column3: therefore it became a jesting idiom in the Shire to say "on Friday the first (of Summerfilth)" when referring to a fictitious day or unlikely events.

column1: Highday represents an archaic Hobbitish form "Hihdei"
column2: a word preserved in the Yellowskin.

column1: Highday is translated as Friday in The Lord of the Rings
column2: however as it was the chief day of the week
column3: its cultural significance rather corresponded to that of our Sunday. For this reason there was one exception

column5: Highday was translated as "Sunday" instead of Friday.
